newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - BTPs eye 129.05 but may correct back.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - BTPs eye 129.05 but may correct back.

text.p: June BTP futures traded on LIFFE will look to the upside towards 129.05 on Friday but the contract may be in for a short-term correction, technical analysts said.
"Near term I'm looking for bit of a correction lower, but I'm not sure how deep this is going to get," said Robin Wilkin, senior technical analyst at MCM YieldWatch in London.
"But overall the current bull run remains in place and we're really looking for it to push up towards the 129.05 high set on March 15 and 17."
At 0711 GMT, June BTP futures were at 128.07, down 0.18.
Wilkin said the market could push up to the area between 128.75 and 129.05, but was not likely to get through that high for now.
"Recent action over the past week or so has gone down through 125.94, so I'm still medium to long-term bearish," he said.
David Wood, an independent technical analyst near London, also said 129.05 was a major high for BTPs and the projected target, with some initial resistance in the 128.55 to 60 zone.
"But BTPs may be getting sucked in at top end. The market looks over done in short term at least," he said.
Traders on the LIFFE floor said the market must hold above 128.00 to maintain the upward bias. However if it failed at this level a rapid fall back to 127.70 and 127.55 was expected.
A downtrend resistance level at 128.45, was attracting the market but it had so far failed to launch a significant attack on that level. If it breaks then 129.00 is called into play, they said.
Wood agreed there was reasonable support in an old resistance area around 128.00 to 127.85.
"If it can pick up strength from there it is looking very good still," he said.
But MCM's Wilkin said current gains from 125.80 still looked corrective at the moment.
"If we get through 129.05 then we would...probably be looking for a move up to the 130-131 congestion area," he said.
At the short end June Eurolira futures were st 93.22, down 0.03 on the day.
